data.name: Possible Triangles Formed with Available Iron Rods
data.description:
We have an array that contains the length of many iron rods, ```available_rods```
The length of the rods are expressed in inches.
We have to form with them:

- triangles that have at least one angle higher than 90° (rigth-angled triangles should be discarded)

- the triangles should not have a side longer than a certain length, ```max_length```

- the triangles should have an area that do not differ more than a certain percentage of relative difference, ```max_rel_diff``` in relative terms with a certain given area, ```est_area```,  value expressed in square feet. (1 in = 0.08333333 ft)

Let's see an example:
```
available_rods = [3, 11, 8, 5, 13, 10, 16, 21, 33] # rounded lengths in inches
max_length = 16 in # all the triangle sides should be under 16 inches
est_area = 0.12 ft², the most suitable area value (for an specific need)
max_rel_diff = 40 % # all the relative difference with estimated area, est_area, have to be under 40%
```
The relative difference is calculated as:
```
rel_differ = |area - est_area| / est_area * 100
```
We list all the possible triangles ```[a, b, c] (a ≤ b < c)``` that have an angle higher than ```90°```, all its sides under the ```max_length``` and with a relative difference under ```max_rel_diff```
```
Triangles [a,b,c]  Biggest Angle(deg)      Area(in²)     Area(ft²)  rel_differ(%)
[3, 10, 11]           101.54               14.6969        0.1021     14.95
[3, 11, 13]           126.22               13.3112        0.0924     22.97
[5, 8, 10]             97.90               19.8100        0.1376     14.64
[5, 8, 11]            113.58               18.3303        0.1273      6.08
[5, 10, 13]           116.10               22.4499        0.1559     29.92
```

We need a function that receives the shown arguments in the following order:
```
sel_pieces(available_rods, max_length, est_area, rel_diff)
```
The function will output the triangles sorted by the lowest value of ```rel_differ```.

The above case will be:
```python
available_rods = [3, 11, 8, 5, 13, 10, 16, 21, 33]
max_length = 16
est_area = 0.12
max_rel_diff = 40
sel_pieces(available_rods, max_length, est_area, rel_diff) == [[5, 8, 11], [5, 8, 10], [3, 10, 11], [3, 11, 13], [5, 10, 13]]
```
In case that there are no triangles that fulfill these properties, the function will output an empty array.
```python
available_rods = [3, 11, 8, 5, 13, 10, 16, 21, 33]
max_length = 16
est_area = 0.12
max_rel_diff = 5
sel_pieces(available_rods, max_length, est_area, rel_diff) == []
```
Features of the tests:
``` 
N (Number of tests) = 150
amount of available rods, l; 10 ≤ l ≤ 60
5 in ≤ max_length ≤ 300 in
0,0069 ft²≤ est_area ≤ 6.25 ft²
5 % ≤ max_rel_differ ≤ 50 %
```
Enjoy it!!
